(a) Linguistic, lexical and terminological 
resources 
• Parallel Corpora (Translation Memories – TM): texts that are translations of 
each other (as opposed to comparable corpora, texts in two languages that are 
similar in content). Parallel corpora can be better exploited by TM, which align 
translation equivalents.
• Glossary: alphabetical list of terms in a particular domain of knowledge with the 
definitions for those terms.
• (Machine-Readable) Dictionary: alphabetically arranged words along with 
information about their forms, pronunciations, functions, etymologies, meanings, 
and syntactical and idiomatic uses.
• (On-line) Encyclopedia: like dictionaries, but with the focus on factual information
• (Computational) Lexicon or lexical database: a resource that organizes lexical 
units in lexical domains making use of lexico-semantic relations (hyponymy-
hypernomymy, meronymy, synonymy, antonymy…)
• Terminological Database: collection of terms in a domain
